storyInfo: Whislash discovers that even years after her retirement, there are still reporters who keenly follow her every move.

attributes.content: One copy of the Central Journal, please.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: ...Zofia? Long time no see.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Same to you, Al. Actually, I'm quite surprised your stand is still running.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Haha, only by the good graces of my old regulars. Hey, out of curiosity, isn't that knight who's been on the front page recently... your niece?
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Niece? Maria's like a little sister, thank you very much.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Haha! Yes, yes, I'll remember next time. I watched the match between her and Brassrust. She's got some of the same grit and spunk you had, back in the day.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Me? Not Margaret?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: No, no. I'd never mistake it.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: ...Haha, I'm not going to argue with you, Al. That's all in the past now.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Sure is. When I look at the news these days, they're talking about new folks every year.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Last year it was the Blood Knight, cover to cover. But this year, quite a few newly-promoted knights have made the headlines.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: I saw. Maria made it too.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: There was a time when you were the talk of the town, too. Hey, what are you looking at?
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: 'Four Seasons Times'? ...Is that a new one? I don't remember seeing it before.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Haha, well, take a gander at the header– 'The Whislash Knight returns to the arena as a coach, guiding Maria Nearl to defeat Ingra the Butcher.'
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Never imagined there would still be reporters paying any attention to my life. I guess news of my shopping spree last weekend wasn't boring enough, so they're coming back for more.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Eh, reporters aren't the same as they used to be either. They used to sip on fine honey, but now they swallow rot.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: ...Still, this one seems to be the real deal. Picks their words carefully, and has a style that isn't overblown. Here, take a look at this!
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: '...Can this up-and-comer from the Nearl family, under the guidance of the Whislash Knight, forge her own radiance in the arena?'
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: 'And if so, could this mean that the Whislash Knight has re-centered herself and is ready for a comeback?'
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Unfortunately... they're going to be disappointed. I'm just doing a little babysitting.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Want to take a copy home?
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Thanks, but no thanks. I already hear more news than I care for these days, Al.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: See you later then, Zofia.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: One copy of the Central Journal, please.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: ...Zofia? It's been a while.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: You've started selling knight merchandise too, Al?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: These little dolls bring in good money, Zofia. Especially the Radiant Knight's. Tch, I go through sixty a day. Meanwhile, I can barely get rid of a few papers.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: I'll let Margaret know how much you appreciate her then. I'm sure she'd be happy to know that.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Hahaha, put it like that, and those reporters with their ears to the ground owe her their lives too. The Radiant Knight's return has been a goldmine for both scoops and sales.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Heck, maybe I should be thanking her too. Without her, I might still be coaching Maria, worrying about how to make it to the next round.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Life's a lot simpler these days. I've been looking at a nice little villa in the countryside—once the dust settles, I plan on moving out of the city.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Don't be like that, there are still plenty of people here who care about you. Here.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: 'Four Seasons Times'... Huh, they're still in print?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: More than that, they've even set up a column dedicated to news about you. Take a look.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: 'The Whislash Knight gives up coaching Maria, wishing to return to a life of luxury.' How do I put this... My lifestyle's not THAT extravagant, is it?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Depends on who you compare it to.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Tch. And would you look at that. You can practically taste the venom dripping from every word.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Read it out loud for me, Al. I want to hear it.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Are you sure? Their choice of words is quite... intense.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Mhm. Go ahead.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: 'After Maria dropped out of the Major, Whislash also made the extremely disappointing decision to step away from her position as coach, and from the arena.'
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: 'After her retirement, she seems to have forgotten the spirit of chivalry, instead sinking into wealth-addled mediocrity, drunk off the wine of complacency.'
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Pffhaha––
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: You can still laugh when they're tearing into you like that?
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: It's obvious from how they put it that they're just a naive child who knows nothing of the world. Why bother getting mad?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Hahaha, I suppose so.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Oh, no need to put it away, Al. I'll take that one too.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: See you later then, Zofia.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: One copy of the Central Journal, please.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: It's been a while, Zofia.
Tytus? What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: I could ask the same of you. I assumed you'd have servants to pick up the paper for you.
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: Hey, you little–
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: I can speak to him myself, Al.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: (Shrugs)
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: Is it just me, or are you always out and about these days, Tytus? Seems like you're enjoying your retirement.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Nothing compared to you, of course. With our champion, the Radiant Knight, at your back, I'm sure your life's positively cushy...
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: Oh, but how could I forget? Since she's been turning down all those sponsorships, maybe our champion's been sponging off of you. So how have you been? Keeping busy?
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: If you know I'm busy, why waste your breath on all that nonsense?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: (Curls lips)
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: I have some connections in the General Chamber of Commerce, and after the finals... I got some news.
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: They're building a brand new arena on the newly-built plate. And while they're at it, they're probably going to develop a new commercial sector nearby. It's a good investment.
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Let me finish—
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: Not interested.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Zofia, at the rate you burn through money, you'll run out one of these days, no matter how big your family business is. Not to mention those self-serving underlings you finally axed last year... Tch, now that's a royal waste of money.
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: That's none of your business.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: ...Well, if you're really not interested, then forget it.
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: Oh right, and I say this with sincerity—Zofia, you're still very young...
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: Tytus, I'll listen when you have something worth saying.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: ...In any case, spare a thought for yourself.
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: Ah yes, thank you for your concern. See you never.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: So, are you going to buy something before you leave?
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: ...Hmph.
attributes.name: Tytus Topola

attributes.content: Looks like a lot of people have been looking for you since the Radiant Knight lifted the trophy.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Margaret... Well, it's not like I can just leave her to her own devices either.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: You've been worrying way too much about the Nearl kids all these years, Zofia.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner
Zofia
attributes.content: Well, we grew up together, and our family origins are—

attributes.name: Zofia
attributes.content: Hey, Al! What's that you're hiding?
*cough* *cough*... Oh, it's nothing.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Hand it over.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: I told you, it's nothing.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Now!
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: ...Here, it's another column from that frizzy kid. Don't get mad, they have no clue what they're talking about.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: There's no text in the column, only a huge photograph occupying the entire page.
It's a picture of me sitting in the audience during the finals. The worry, uneasiness, and thick, palpable pride on my face are all clearly captured by the camera.
Even the nigh-imperceptible envy in my eyes could not escape the keen lens.
Above the photograph appears an extremely eye-catching title printed in thick, black ink.
'The Nearl Family's Best Attendant'
The kid's got guts...
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Zofia...
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Zofia offhandedly folds the newspaper to cover half the picture, obscuring the faces in the auditorium so that only the dazzling knight on the field remains.
See you later, Al.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Miss Zofia! Miss Zofia!
...Who is it? And where am I?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Hurry, wake up! I'm so glad I found you, I was scared half to death! Why were you sleeping in the bushes?
...Partied too hard last night. Haven't drunk like that in a long while. Help me up, Lily.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Careful now.
attributes.name: Servant

attributes.content: Did they leave yet?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Mmhmm. Miss Margaret and Miss Maria both had a bit much to drink, so the butler arranged for a driver to take them home not too long ago.
attributes.name: Servant

attributes.content: Where's Młynar?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Did you forget? He didn't even stay halfway through before leaving.
attributes.name: Servant

attributes.content: ...I guess I was already pretty wasted by then.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: I haven't seen you indulge yourself like that in a long time.
attributes.name: Servant

attributes.content: Margaret deserved the toast.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Oh, allow me to see you to your bedchamber.
attributes.name: Servant

attributes.content: Hold on.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Who's there? Show yourself!
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Let go! Let go of me!
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: A reporter? How'd you get in here?! Miss Zofia, should I call the police?
attributes.name: Servant

attributes.content: No need. You can head back first.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Servant

attributes.content: Don't worry. I can toss this runt back over the walls myself.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Please don't hesitate to call me if needed.
attributes.name: Servant

attributes.content: How old are you? Fifteen? Sixteen?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: I'm an adult!
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: 'Four Seasons Times'... So YOU'RE that reporter.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Please give me my badge back.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Are you aware that trespassing is a crime?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: I'm sorry... I just wanted...
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Seeing how you chased me all the way here, you might as well ask what's on your mind while you've got the chance.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: If you have the guts to barge into my house, surely you have the guts to sit on my sofa?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Take a seat.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Let's just call this an interview. I'm sure you've got pages of questions you've been itching to ask.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: I'm new to the job... I've never done an interview before.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Perfect. Now's your chance to practice.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Uhh... I'm really sorry, I broke into your house on an impulse. I'm willing to accept the consequences, be it a fine or jail time—
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: You know, normally an interview begins with a self-introduction. I'll get started for you.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: My name's Zofia, formerly known as the Whislash Knight, now retired. A sister to both Maria and the Radiant Knight. Well, technically their aunt, but whatever.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: I'm also a VIP at Golden Palm Bank, a super-VIP at the Starlight Street shopping mall, and a swindled customer of various real estate moguls... Oh right, and occasionally the center of attention for the tabloids.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: No, that's not you...
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Then who am I, in your eyes?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: I've watched the recordings of all your matches, and read every article... You were different during each phase of your career.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Then start with the 'me' you have the deepest impression of.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Oh, here it is. It's from this time... You wore a ponytail back then, just like Maria.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: After the Radiant Knight left, the decline of the Nearl family was inevitable, so you stepped into the arena seeking to save everything for her sake... I still have photos from that time.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: That was such a long time ago. Not even I kept that photo.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: But yeah. Margaret went far, far, away. Młynar didn't want to become a knight, preferring to wear a tie and sit in a cubicle, so I had to step up and make something happen.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Just for the Nearl family?
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Of course not. After being bathed in the Radiant Knight's light, how could I not let it touch my heart? Of course I wanted to pierce the darkness covering Kazimierz with my own strength, sword in hand.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: But you weren't able to...
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Hey, where'd you get that photo? Get rid of it! It makes me look ugly!
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: No! I worked so hard to buy this one!
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: You kids really are something else. Why work your butt off for a picture of a knight with a bruised nose?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: This is a photo of your last fight. Ever since your defeat to Fissure in the round of 16, you were never seen in the arena again.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: My left hand was injured.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: But you fought to the end with your right.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Gee, thanks for reminding me. I'm sure I would've forgotten all about it!
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Sorry, I shouldn't have brought it up.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: It's fine. Getting injured was only part of the reason I decided to retire. There were some things buried too deeply for me to think about back then.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: But when I look back at it now, more and more I think it was the disillusionment. Though I'd already expected it to some extent, once I was fully exposed to the filth beneath the glamor of knightsports, I really couldn't find a reason to keep going.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Not everyone has the never-ending light to dispel the darkness wherever they go, like the Radiant Knight.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Most fall right there, on the cusp before daybreak. Even if they point their swords to the sky, they can only swing at the infinite darkness.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: But you were still willing to be Maria Nearl's coach and help her shine in the arena.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: All I did was teach her how to survive in the darkness.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: I couldn't teach her anything I didn't know how to do myself.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: I mean she managed that on her own.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Be it with Maria or Margaret... There was nothing I could do.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: At least... they were able to bring you joy with what they accomplished. Like you said in 'Sports Afternoon,' you're proud of them.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: You're right, I am. The Four Seasons Times echoed a similar sentiment in that one article, 'the Nearl Family's Best Attendant.'
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: ...That was just a spur-of-the-moment thing.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: (*Shakes head*) Haha, don't worry. I didn't take it personally.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: But that's not what the look on your face said. I saw you at the newsstand that day, and your expression was different from usual.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Okay, now this is getting creepy... How long have you been stalking me, kiddo?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: I've been taking photos for the last few months, but I've been following you for the last six years and twenty-eight days.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: ...Okay, you're definitely going to land yourself in jail one day.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Sure, but I'll also land myself the greatest honor a reporter can get.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Suit yourself, doesn't matter at this point. Let's get back on topic.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: The moment I saw that photo, some things clicked in my head that I wasn't sure of before.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: I'll admit it, I was jealous of Margaret, but I'm not sure whether it was her combat prowess, her Originium Arts, her being a Pegasus, or the 'Nearl' name.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: None of those things matter. You wouldn't envy the Radiant Knight over little things like that.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: I guess I was just sad that I couldn't be like her, charging towards a goal from start to finish. Without hesitation, fearing neither hardship nor darkness.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: ...You've never thought about stepping back into the arena?
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: I'd rather die.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: So... do you miss your competitive days?
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: At least I knew what I wanted back then.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: ...May I write an article and publish what you just said?
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Knock yourself out. I don't care, and the people I care about don't care either.
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: Will you buy a copy of the Four Seasons Times next week to read it?
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Let's cross that bridge when we come to it, shall we?
attributes.name: Zofia

attributes.content: One copy of the Central Journal, please.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Here you go, kid. There aren't many people like you who read the papers these days.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: You talk too much, gramps.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Hey, it's a bit old-fashioned, but you should buy another one if you're waiting for someone.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: You've been following her around for so long, you really think I wouldn't notice the camera behind your newspaper? Look, she's coming this way right now.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: When she sees the familiar figure, the reporter perks up, raising her camera and pointing it at the woman across the street.
In her right hand is a freshly-bought cup of coffee, wispy steam coming off the rim of the cup.

When she gets to her car, she moves the cup from her right hand to her left and tries to grab the keys from her purse. Her left hand is impaired, and the coffee is very hot, so she can only hold it from an awkward position.
Upon seeing her distress, passersby try to help her on multiple occasions, but each time she refuses.
Seeing the woman grit her teeth in pain and rummage through her purse for her keys, the reporter cannot help but squeeze her camera tightly.
The look on her face reminds her of the videos she had seen, where this woman fought against all sorts of powerful enemies with a similar expression.
After a painstaking amount of time, the woman finally manages to wrestle the ring of keys from her purse.
Why'd you put the camera down? Not going to shoot?
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: There's no need.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Why not?
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: She found it.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Her keys were right there in her purse. She was going to dig them out sooner or later.
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Hahahaha!
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Hey kid, keep your hands on the handlebars when you're riding a bike!
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Catch you later, gramps!
attributes.name: Immature Reporter

attributes.content: Heh. Kids these days.
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: Good evening, Al.
One copy of the Central Journal?
attributes.name: Newsstand Owner

attributes.content: No, I'll have a copy of the Four Seasons Times, please.
attributes.name: Zofia
